DataElement.preferredName: History Phakomatosis Comorbidity Present Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the phakomatosis comorbidities that were present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events._A hereditary syndrome affecting the central nervous system that is associated with lesions of the skin and retina. Representative examples include neurofibromatosis, tuberous sclerosis, von Hippel-Lindau syndrome, and Sturge-Weber syndrome._The coexistence of two or more disease processes._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
